article.headline: Siena 79, Marist 60
article.story: POUGHKEEPSIE, N.Y. -- Alex Franklin finished with 22 points and seven rebounds and Siena extended Division I's longest winning streak to 13 games with a 79-60 victory over Marist on Saturday. The Saints (19-4, 12-0 Metro Atlantic Athletic Conference) equaled their best conference start, which was set last year, and improved to 36-2 in their past 38 MAAC games. It is the program's longest winning streak since winning 14 in a row in 1988-89. Siena never trailed and led by double figures for the final 16:05. The Saints shot 60 percent from the field (29-for-48) and held an opponent to 61 points or fewer for the fourth straight game. Franklin finished 8-for-9 from the field. Ryan Rossiter had 16 points and 10 boards, Edwin Ubiles scored 15 and Ronald Moore dished out 11 assists for Siena. Korey Bauer scored 18 and Daye Kaba added 17 points for Marist (1-21, 1-11).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
